page.title: 07SANDHURST VILLAGE CUSTOMS
page.content: LOCAL EVENTS There are a number of traditional events in Sandhurst, many of which are connected with the Church or the Womens Institute but none are nationally well known. In summer an annual Fete is held in the Village Hall and in December there is a Christmas Fair. Each June a day out is organised by the Womens Instit- ute for all the elderly residents of the village. When they return a special meal is arranged for them in the Hall. At Christmas a big dinner is provided, with all the traditional trimmings. Other annual events include a Harvest Supper and a Flower Festival which is held in the Church. The River Severn near Sandhurst is a traditional elver fishing site for locals in spring and in summer the Gloucester Regatta is held there.
